title: 113_s1415
content:
The Act is titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" and includes definitions for clarity. The Act titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" defines "Federal land" as approximately 17,826 acres depicted on a specific map, "planning area" as land administered by the Bureau of Land Management in various districts, and "public domain land" as defined in the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The term "public domain land" is defined as per the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976, excluding land managed under a specific Act. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "Tribe" specifically denotes the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE.

All US rights to Federal land, including minerals, shall be held in trust for the Tribe. A survey to establish boundaries must be completed within 180 days.

SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of Federal land with specified committees. The filed map and legal description will have the same force as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct errors. The information will be available for public inspection. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. This Act does not affect existing Tribe rights to land. Prohibitions include restrictions on exporting unprocessed logs and using trust land for gaming. SEC. 6. FOREST MANAGEMENT. Commercial forestry on Federal land must comply with Federal laws. SEC. 7. LAND RECLASSIFICATION. The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary must identify Oregon and California Railroad land within 180 days. Public domain land of similar acreage and condition must be identified within 18 months. Maps depicting the identified lands must be submitted to Congress within 2 years. The identified public domain land will be reclassified as land owned by the railroad after public comment. After public comment, the Secretary will reclassify identified land as owned by the Oregon and California Railroad. The Act of August 28, 1937 will apply to the reclassified land.
